00048 #import <UIKit/UIKit.h>
00049 #import <SystemConfiguration/SystemConfiguration.h>
00050 
00051 @class Reachability;
00052 
00053 @interface Reachability : NSObject {
00054     
00055 @private
00056         BOOL _networkStatusNotificationsEnabled;
00057         
00058         NSString *_hostName;
00059         NSString *_address;
00060     
00061         NSMutableDictionary *_reachabilityQueries;
00062 }
00063 
00064 /*
00065  An enumeration that defines the return values of the network state
00066  of the device.
00067  */
00068 typedef enum {
00069         NotReachable = 0,
00070         ReachableViaCarrierDataNetwork,
00071         ReachableViaWiFiNetwork
00072 } NetworkStatus;
00073 
00074 
00075 // Set to YES to register for changes in network status. Otherwise reachability queries
00076 // will be handled synchronously.
00077 @property BOOL networkStatusNotificationsEnabled;
00078 // The remote host whose reachability will be queried.
00079 // Either this or 'addressName' must be set.
00080 @property (nonatomic, retain) NSString *hostName;
00081 // The IP address of the remote host whose reachability will be queried.
00082 // Either this or 'hostName' must be set.
00083 @property (nonatomic, retain) NSString *address;
00084 // A cache of ReachabilityQuery objects, which encapsulate a SCNetworkReachabilityRef, a host or address, and a run loop. The keys are host names or addresses.
00085 @property (nonatomic, assign) NSMutableDictionary *reachabilityQueries;
00086 
00087 // This class is intended to be used as a singleton.
00088 + (Reachability *)sharedReachability;
00089 
00090 // Is self.hostName is not nil, determines its reachability.
00091 // If self.hostName is nil and self.address is not nil, determines the reachability of self.address.
00092 - (NetworkStatus)remoteHostStatus;
00093 // Is the device able to communicate with Internet hosts? If so, through which network interface?
00094 - (NetworkStatus)internetConnectionStatus;
00095 // Is the device able to communicate with hosts on the local WiFi network? (Typically these are Bonjour hosts).
00096 - (NetworkStatus)localWiFiConnectionStatus;
00097 
00098 /*
00099  When reachability change notifications are posted, the callback method 'ReachabilityCallback' is called
00100  and posts a notification that the client application can observe to learn about changes.
00101  */
00102 static void ReachabilityCallback(SCNetworkReachabilityRef target, SCNetworkReachabilityFlags flags, void *info);
00103 
00104 @end
00105 
00106 @interface ReachabilityQuery : NSObject
00107 {
00108 @private
00109         SCNetworkReachabilityRef _reachabilityRef;
00110         CFMutableArrayRef _runLoops;
00111         NSString *_hostNameOrAddress;
00112 }
00113 // Keep around each network reachability query object so that we can
00114 // register for updates from those objects.
00115 @property (nonatomic) SCNetworkReachabilityRef reachabilityRef;
00116 @property (nonatomic, retain) NSString *hostNameOrAddress;
00117 @property (nonatomic) CFMutableArrayRef runLoops;
00118 
00119 - (void)scheduleOnRunLoop:(NSRunLoop *)inRunLoop;
00120 
00121 @end
